bill.title: A resolution designating the week of August 10 through August 16, 2014, as "National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week".

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4846; text as passed Senate: CR S4770-4771)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S4846; text as passed Senate: CR S4770-4771)

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4846; text as passed Senate: CR S4770-4771)

item.text:
Designates the week of August 10 through August 16, 2014, as National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week and expresses support for its goals and ideals.

Encourages the continued support of such clinics so that they may continue to serve as health care workforce development sites for the next generation of primary care providers.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the week of August 10 through August 16, 2014, as National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week and expresses support for its goals and ideals.

Encourages the continued support of such clinics so that they may continue to serve as health care workforce development sites for the next generation of primary care providers.
item.name: Passed Senate without amendment

item.title: A resolution designating the week of August 10 through August 16, 2014, as "National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week".
A resolution designating the week of August 10 through August 16, 2014, as "National Nurse-Managed Health Clinic Week".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
